And so one of the themes I think is that the SEC needs to modernize market structure, which I totally agree with. And frankly, a lot of people in the industry agree with. So there are two new rule proposals that came out of the SEC of the four that were really focused on that. The first was Update Rule 605, which is just a quantitative disclosure of execution quality and a venue. And now it will be extended to some large brokers. So you'll get a lot more visibility and transparency into how your orders are being handled. Hard to argue against it. And there has not been much opposition to it. And then the updates to Reagan MS again are to modernize markets. They're addressing tick size, which is the quoting and trading increments in markets, which are set to a penny for most stocks. And it's sort of a one size fits all approach to markets that doesn't really work. So they recognize that they're looking to shrink the tick size. Our argument was don't shrink it as much as you are talking about. And also widen it on the other side for less liquid stocks. And that will improve liquidity and execution quality on the other side.
